intro: Plectritis macrocera var. eichleriana, commonly known as the Eichler's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has slender, branched stems and small, linear leaves. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for ecological restoration and native plant gardens.
